alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Moore; Richmond (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:01PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Moore, southeastern Montgomery and northeastern Richmond Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 459 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Biscoe, or 13 miles east of Troy. This storm was nearly stationary. A second strong storm is located just east of Seven Lakes and is also nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Pines, Carthage, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Biscoe, Pinebluff, Foxfire, Star, Candor and Taylortown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
